The image and claim originated from a pr: a coalition of groups aiming to preserve the Affordable Care Act.
The claim states that 3: 2 million Americans lost coverage in the first year of the Republican war on health care, which falls at the high end of estimates.
The claim is supported by Gallup: s estimation that a 1.3 point increase in uninsured Americans represents approximately 3.2 million people.
The CDC: s National Health Interview Survey, with its large sample size of over 78,000 people, is considered to provide the most accurate and definitive point estimates of changes in insurance coverage.
